Patent Information.Patent Title: Antimicrobial peptide isolated from halocynthia aurantium.
Patent Information.Abstract: The present invention relates to an antimicrobial peptide isolated from Halocynthia aurantium, more particularly, to an antimicrobial peptide isolated from the body fluid of Halocynthia aurantium and an antimicrobial agent comprising the same as an active ingredient. The antimicrobial peptide of the present invention shows excellent antimicrobial activity under strong acidic and basic environments. Moreover, it also shows strong antimicrobial activity against resistant bacteria. So, it can be used usefully as a natural antimicrobial agent.

Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Function: Antimicrobial activity against S.aureus and P.aeruginosa, possibly by attacking the bacterial cell membrane. Mouse model

Literature.Title: Halocidin a new antimicrobial peptide from hemocytes of the solitary tunicate, Halocynthia aurantium.
Literature.Author: Jang WS, Kim KN, Lee YS, Nam MH, Lee IH.

Literature.Title: Halocidin: a new antimicrobial peptide from hemocytes of the solitary tunicate, Halocynthia aurantium.
